svg.text: constructor → connectedCallback → render → renderedCallback → disconnectedCallback | errorCallback
DOM ready · every re-render · use guard
What You Can and Cannot Do
constructor(), connectedCallback(), render() — parent runs first
renderedCallback() — deepest child fires first, parent fires last
Any reactive property change re-triggers render() → renderedCallback()
Use this._initialized guard in renderedCallback() to prevent infinite loops
⚠ Calling this.template.querySelector() in constructor() → null (DOM not ready)
⚠ Setting reactive property in renderedCallback() without guard → infinite loop
⚠ Assuming renderedCallback() fires only once — it fires on EVERY re-render
⚠ Forgetting to unsubscribe() in disconnectedCallback() — LMS memory leak
LWC.guide — Expert-Level Proficiency Prep · Salesforce LWC Developer Guide
